Bacon Jam and Eggs

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to the world of indulgent breakfast creations! If you're looking to elevate your morning routine, this Bacon Jam and Eggs recipe is the perfect solution. Imagine the rich, savory taste of crispy bacon blended into a sweet and tangy jam, generously spooned over perfectly cooked eggs. This delightful combination not only satisfies your taste buds but also brings a gourmet twist to a classic breakfast dish. Whether you're planning a weekend brunch or just want to start your day with something special, this recipe is a must-try. Packed with simple ingredients like chopped bacon, onions, brown sugar, and apple cider vinegar, our Bacon Jam is easy to make and utterly addictive. Pair it with eggs cooked to your liking for a hearty and flavorful meal that will keep you energized throughout the day. Get ready to impress your family and friends with this unique culinary creation that transforms everyday ingredients into a breakfast masterpiece!

Ingredients

bacon (chopped)

Use thick-cut bacon for a heartier texture and richer flavor. If you want a healthier option, turkey bacon can be used, though it will alter the flavor and texture. For a vegetarian alternative, consider using smoked tempeh or a plant-based bacon.

onion (finely chopped)

Yellow onions are ideal for this recipe due to their balanced sweetness. If you prefer a milder flavor, you can substitute with shallots or green onions. Caramelizing the onions longer will enhance their sweetness and depth.

brown sugar

Light brown sugar will provide a subtle molasses flavor, while dark brown sugar will give a deeper taste. If you need a substitute, you can use white sugar mixed with a bit of molasses (1 tbsp of molasses per cup of white sugar) to mimic the flavor.

apple cider vinegar

This adds a tangy flavor to balance the sweetness. If you don't have it, white wine vinegar or balsamic vinegar can work as substitutes, but they will impart a different taste. For a sweeter alternative, try using lemon juice.

eggs

Fresh eggs will yield the best flavor and texture. If you're looking for a healthier option, consider using egg whites or egg substitutes, though this will reduce the richness. For extra flavor, whisk in a pinch of cheese or herbs into the eggs before cooking.

salt

Adjust salt according to your taste and dietary restrictions. Consider using kosher salt for cooking and finishing for a better texture. You can also try smoked salt for an added flavor dimension that complements the bacon.

black pepper

Freshly ground black pepper is best for maximum flavor. If you want to add a bit of heat, consider using cayenne pepper or a dash of hot sauce in your egg preparation.

butter

Use unsalted butter to control the saltiness in your dish. For a richer flavor, try using ghee or a flavored butter (like herb-infused). If you want a dairy-free option, substitute with olive oil or coconut oil.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Cook the Bacon

    In a skillet over medium heat, cook the chopped bacon until crispy. This will render the fat needed for the jam.

  • Step 2: Drain Excess Fat

    Remove the bacon from the skillet and drain excess fat, leaving about 1 tablespoon in the pan. This is crucial to avoid an overly greasy jam.

  • Step 3: Sauté the Onions

    Add the finely chopped onion to the skillet and sauté until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. This will add sweetness and depth to the jam.

  • Step 4: Add Sugar and Vinegar

    Stir in the brown sugar and apple cider vinegar, simmering for about 5-7 minutes until it thickens slightly. This is where the jam gets its unique flavor profile.

  • Step 5: Combine Bacon and Mixture

    Add the cooked bacon back to the skillet and mix well to combine. Remove from heat and set aside. This allows the flavors to meld together.

  • Step 6: Cook the Eggs

    In a separate pan, melt butter over medium heat, then crack in the eggs. Cook to your preference (sunny side up, over easy, etc.).

  • Step 7: Season the Eggs

    Season the eggs with salt and pepper to taste. This enhances their natural flavor.

  • Step 8: Serve

    Serve the eggs topped with a generous spoonful of bacon jam. This creates a deliciously sweet and savory combination.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I chop bacon without making a mess?

To chop bacon easily, place the strips in the freezer for about 15-20 minutes until they're slightly firm. This will make them easier to cut without slipping. Use a sharp knife and cut across the strips into small pieces.

What should I do if my onions burn while cooking?

If your onions start to burn, immediately lower the heat and add a small splash of water or broth to deglaze the pan. This will stop the burning process and lift the flavorful bits off the bottom of the pan.

How do I know when my bacon is crispy enough?

Cook the bacon until it is a deep golden brown and has a nice crispy texture. It will continue to crisp up slightly as it cools, so don't worry if it seems a bit soft when you first take it out of the pan.

What is the best way to crack an egg without getting shell pieces in the pan?

Crack the egg on a flat surface rather than the edge of a bowl. This helps avoid shell fragments. Use your thumbs to gently pull the shell apart over the pan.

How can I safely handle hot pans and avoid burns?

Always use oven mitts or pot holders when handling hot pans. Make sure to keep your workspace clear to avoid accidental spills, and be cautious when leaning over the stove to prevent steam burns.

What can I substitute for apple cider vinegar if I don’t have it?

You can use white wine vinegar or red wine vinegar as a substitute. If you need a sweeter flavor, balsamic vinegar works well too.

How do I know when my eggs are cooked to the right doneness?

For sunny side up eggs, the whites should be set and the yolk runny. For over easy, flip the egg when the whites are almost set and cook for an additional minute. Use a spatula to gently touch the yolk; it should have a slight give for perfect doneness.

What’s the best way to store leftover bacon jam?

Allow the bacon jam to cool completely, then transfer it to an airtight container. It can be stored in the refrigerator for up to two weeks. Reheat it gently on the stove or in the microwave before serving.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a gluten-free option, ensure that the bread or toast is gluten-free. To make this dish healthier, consider using turkey bacon or a plant-based bacon alternative for a lower-fat version. For a vegetarian option, omit the bacon jam and serve the eggs with sautéed mushrooms and spinach instead, ensuring to use a plant-based butter substitute if necessary.

Pairings

This dish pairs beautifully with toasted sourdough bread or English muffins, which can help soak up the richness of the bacon jam and eggs. For beverages, consider serving with a robust coffee or a sparkling mimosa to balance the savory flavors. For those who enjoy a kick, a spicy Bloody Mary complements the dish well.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the bacon jam and eggs on a warm plate to maintain temperature. Garnish with fresh herbs such as chives or parsley for added color and freshness. A side of arugula or mixed greens dressed lightly with lemon vinaigrette can provide a refreshing contrast to the richness of the dish. For a brunch setting, consider presenting the dish family-style in a skillet, allowing guests to serve themselves.

Bacon Jam and Eggs

25 min
$5
450 kcal
Difficulty: 30%
Servings: 2

Allergens:

Eggs

Dietary Tags:

High ProteinGluten Free

Cuisine:

American

Course:

BreakfastBrunch

Tags:

BreakfastBrunchEasySavory

Description

A sweet and savory twist on breakfast with rich bacon jam and perfectly cooked eggs.

Ingredients

  • bacon (chopped): 6 strips
  • onion (finely chopped): 1 medium
  • brown sugar: 2 tbsp
  • apple cider vinegar: 2 tbsp
  • eggs: 4
  • salt: to taste
  • black pepper: to taste
  • butter: 1 tbsp

Date Created:

11/22/2024
